templates.type: * (Integer) The template type. 1 = container; 2 = Swarm stack; 3 = Compose stack
templates.title: * (String) The template title.
templates.image: * (String) The Docker image associated with a template.
templates.administrators-only: (Boolean) Indicates whether or not a template should be available just to admin users.
templates.name: (String) The default name of a template (shows in the Portainer UI).
templates.registry: (String) The registry where the Docker image is stored. If not specified, Portainer will use Docker Hub as the default.
templates.command: (String) The command to run in the container. If not specified, the container will use the default command in its Dockerfile.

env.name: the name of the environment variable, as supported in the container image (mandatory)
env.label: label for the input in the UI (mandatory unless set is present)
env.description: a short description for this input, will be available as a tooltip in the UI (optional)
env.default: default value associated to the variable (optional)
env.preset: boolean. If set to true, the UI will not generate an input (optional)
env.select: an array of possible values, will generate a select input (optional)

templates.network: (String) A string that corresponds to the name of an existing Docker network. Will auto-select the network in the templates view.
templates.privileged: (Boolean) Indicates whether or not the container should be started in privileged mode. Defaults to false if not specified.
templates.interactive: (Boolean) Indicates whether or not the container should be started in foreground mode. Defaults to false if not specified.
templates.restart_policy: (String) The restart policy associated with the container. Will default to "always" if no value is specified.
templates.hostname: (String) The hostname of the container. Will default to Docker if not specified.
templates.note: (String) Extra information about a template, for example what it is used for. Displayed inside the template-creation form in the Portainer UI. Supports HTML.
categories: An array of categories associated with a template. Populates the category filter in the Portainer UI.
